TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content:
Seriously tempted with a ' Yo momma so fat ... she needed 3 mainsails and 4 stages to ensure a stable orbit around her waist ' joke, but I wont

BWAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAA *gaaaaaaaaassssp* AAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA

Ahh, geek humor...

/wipes eyes

...do you perhaps mean the MÃƒÂ¼n?

If not, well I won't say anything more. One may actually say "mum's the word". >_>

Yeah, typo. The fact I got that much weight, the second stage, into low Mun orbit from the launch weight shows that one can improve a design, as well as find the most efficient path for encounter using no mods, the rewards in fuel savings is worth the effort.
I sent my MÃƒÂ¼n probe to the MÃƒÂ¼n. I warped past the encounter, ran out of fuel and in desperation hyperedited it into MÃƒÂ¼n orbit and deployed the probe lander.

Just landed my first rover, on the Mun

I got so nervous when I was about to do the switching of the rocket and the skycrane, the skycrane had so much small amount of fuel, if you did it too late or early the whole mission would be lost.

The landing was very soft and the rover didn't even bounce like usually happens with me in landers.

After landing I quickly added throttle to the skycrane and it flew away! (My intentions were to release the rover slightly before touching down but in KSP it's hard to tell the altitude since the altitude meter counts from sea level or something like that).

The launch vehicle is very wobbly (more with ASAS on...) and was design JUST for that landing, after lots of tests and trials and errors.

But it was actually pretty nice, there was actually plenty of fuel left in both the orbiting and capture & slow down stages.

Missions to make satellite networks on Mun and Minmus and land a rover on Minmus is already planned.
I flew for 15 minutes and literally got slingshot "666666 m" Away from the solar system.

BWAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAA *gaaaaaaaaassssp* AAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA

Ahh, geek humor...

/wipes eyes

I prefer, "You momma so fat, she collapsed into herself and formed a singularity of infinite fatness. Time comes to an end near that [expletive]!"

My faithful kerbals were saved by a joint effort of a rescue team and what i like to call the KSSV (Kerbin System Service Vehicle.). It took me a while but I got the lil' green guys back home today.

On their way to the rescue vehicle...

Scanning for kethane. A lot of scanning was needed because of (totally awesome ) update. So far i got Mun, Minmus and Eve done. And after finishing with Eve i've relocated my MapSat to Gilly. Which took a lot of time - this rock is so tiny, and its SoI is so pathetic getting an encounter was harder than entire flight from Kerbin.

I got my flag planted on the Mun, and as a bonus Jeb still got a craft with enough fuel to get home.

Nailed that landing after 2 attempts ...err simulations, mostly because I was trying to do a gentle curve to the surface but that didnt kill my speed enough, then I just killed nearly all my speed so I was basically dropping straight down to the surface, landed with no lateral movement... didnt even use my RCS as I just killed any lateral movement by shifting my engines to the opposite direction the retro grade marker was sliding off centre towards...keeping that sucker in the centre and landed gently.

Only odd thing was my engines started shaking I got worried they will fall off, so I throttled up and dropped back down again which sorted out the shakes... odd.

Jeb got out the can, down the ladder which worked perfectly despite failing on Kerbin... planted flag took pictures and had some fun hopping around the Mun.

Next getting home, shouldnt be too much of a issue as fuel is good and the engines are efficient, just going to orbit around the Mun so I come from the darkside and behind the Muns orbit and burn for Kerbin, nowt fancy... not even a air brake in the atmosphere... but hey, flag is planted on the Mun.

The second addition to my airship fleet, this is Arch-Angel Industries Halo Airship, dedicated for delivering cargo to various places on Kerbin. Massing in at 57 tons. It's cruising altitude empty is 3km at 58m/s and it has been tested with payloads up to 70 metric tons.

Not feeling up to the task to build a lander capable of returning from the Mun to Kerbin, I opted for a probe lander with a rover.

Last stage failed and the lander had to stabailze orbit around Kerbin itself.

Shot up a new transfer stage and met up with the lander - RSC fuel ran out with the transfer stage half a meter left to the docking port on the lander ... which had to use its own RCS to finish the docking.

Set course for the Mun and entered a quite elliptic orbit. Transfered all remaining fuel to the lander - and had to manually equalize eight tanks, after I realized they put my craft off balance and into a spiraling dance during every maneuver.

One quickload later I also extended the solar panels ...

One quickload more and the second attempt to land on the moon - at night ... - was successful.

Waited until morning and deployed the probe rover - driving is much different up here then back on Kerbin. And I also was glad I tried out the lander on the launch pad, no difficulties on the Mun itself.

Now: up to the next task - send Kerbals up and bring them home again!

Now im not sure what to do in KSP next

Sounds like you need

...inspiration.

Launched few satellites to polar orbit using my multiple satellite launcher with 5 satellites. The thing had far more deltaV than necessary so i added another stage to see if i send it all the way to Jool. The launch succeeded on 3rd try and after i got into space it was easy going. After the arrival to Jool i detached one satellite and sent it to Pol. I will put one satellite to each of the Jool's moons tomorrow.

The launcher

Orbiting pol wit less than 8km apoapsis

One probe gone 4 remaining

*headdesk* Moho...how i hate thee. I thought getting to Gilly was like stabbing at a fly with a needle...in flight Moho is worse. I had to make craziest, longest and most convoluted mid-course correction burn to get encounter with that blasted rock. In three planes at once. And then do another 6 minute burn at periapsis to capture my probe into stable orbit. Good thing the MapSat is light and carries a lot of dV.
I finished a fleet of ships that will fly to Duna. A space station, surface base, and even a space plane are included!
Got a Mun station up and running, it was a lot easier than I thought it would be. I think I might queue up a bunch of components for a Duna station now (dream big, right?)

*headdesk* Moho...how i hate thee. I thought getting to Gilly was like stabbing at a fly with a needle...in flight Moho is worse. I had to make craziest, longest and most convoluted mid-course correction burn to get encounter with that blasted rock. In three planes at once. And then do another 6 minute burn at periapsis to capture my probe into stable orbit. Good thing the MapSat is light and carries a lot of dV.

Notice how my Moho ribbon has a black band. I feel your pain.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

My first successful mission to the MÃƒÂ¼n and back. Such a thrill! The third picture reflects how much fuel I had left after my re-insertion burn
Started my KSP fan game. (Check my sig) Left Jeb on the Mun. Killed like a dozen kerbals trying to get a VTOL to work.

Installed IonCross Crew Support plugin. And QUICKLY made a refit of my tanking-module to get some scrubbers and Oxygen up to my 2 part's station. So its now a 3 part station with the lifesupport.

Tadaa ! Still a newbie on this game, but used mechjeb to learn some basic stuff. (its really good for learning how-to) ... exept the docking part.. i let MJ handle that..

Edited: Double. Didnt read it had to be approved first post.

Edited July 1, 2013 by Leveller

Started a new fiction series!

Kerbal Khronicles - 01 - Newcomers
I turned the Ravenspear mk4 into a SSTO.
I ended my giant space station flight after loads of work due to the fact it started getting wonky when I docked, good reason to start again and build a better one, and bigger
